image.altText: A woman with cropped blonde hair and glasses dressed as a penguin, speaking to a class of children

props.synopsis: Severe heatwave conditions around the country see students swelter through their first weeks of school, sparking calls for the government to properly address rising temperatures in classrooms.

title.children: Back to school heatwaves expose aging public school infrastructure

image.altText: Three generations of women stand together, Pounamu is 18, then her grandmother Ihapera, 66, and mother Natasha, 40.

props.synopsis: Last century, children were forced to write lines of 'I will not speak Māori' as punishment. Now as grandparents, they fear progress around the use of the Māori language is at stake.

title.children: 'I will not speak Māori': Fears new policies in NZ threaten 50 years of progress

image.altText: Jason Clare looks serious while listening to a journalist in the Parliament House courtyard.

props.synopsis: After more than a year, Education Minister Jason Clare has the reports from three major reviews of the education system. He wanted 'spiky ideas' and got them in spades, but what will he do with them?

title.children: The government has its map for education reform, where to now?

image.altText: Jodie Belyea and Richard Marles celebrating in a group of people wearing red.

props.synopsis: Jodie Belyea claims victory in by-election in the federal seat of Dunkley in Melbourne's south-east.

title.children: Labor primary vote holds strong in by-election in Melbourne seat of Dunkley, with Jodie Belyea claiming victory

image.altText: Tom Gleeson on the set of Hard Quiz gesturing behind him with a serious expression.

props.synopsis: Oh, you're back? Something to prove after last week's effort? Let's see what you've got.

title.children: You won a trivia night once? Cute. Now it’s time to play, HARD!

image.altText: A woman dressed in a white short skirt and a crown

props.synopsis: They came dressed head to toe in glitter, rainbows, mesh and feathers, but as thousands of people partied at the 46th Sydney Mardi Gras parade, two men were firmly in everyone's mind.

title.children: Protesters can't halt Sydney Mardi Gras as thousands turn out to celebrate

image.altText: Rossy Smith smiling next to two children.

props.synopsis: Despite homophobia, cultural taboos and misinformation, when beloved gay uncle Rossy Smith died of AIDS, it changed First Nations health forever.

title.children: ‘They said we couldn’t name a football tournament after a gay, Black man with AIDS'. It was one of the most successful events ever

image.altText: Young daughter Alijana Papas (8) sitting on mother Johanna Papas lap in their kitchen looking into her eyes.

props.synopsis: Alijana Papas' life could have been far different had she not contracted meningococcal B as a baby. A vaccine is available, but only a handful of states and territories include it in their national immunisation schedule.

title.children: Alijana entered a fight for her life when she contracted this deadly meningococcal strain

image.altText: A collage of newspaper clippings of the Coodabeen Champions

props.synopsis: From skewering the football industry to finding themselves oddly ensconced within it, the Coodabeen Champions bow out of broadcasting with a remarkable and unlikely legacy.

title.children: How an unlikely radio program by a group of mates changed football forever

image.altText: Jared Waerea-Hargreaves takes a selfie with fans in front of a 'fabulous Las Vegas' sign.

props.synopsis: The NRL is betting on winning over new fans in Las Vegas, where throngs of rugby league diehards have arrived for the season-opening double-header.

title.children: 'It's an Aussie invasion': Inside the NRL's big gamble as rugby league rolls into Vegas

image.altText: A small fuzzy mammal that's black with white spots

props.synopsis: When it comes to blending in, there's a lot we can learn from the animal kingdom. And while the reasons for camouflage vary, they all come back to survival.

title.children: Why do quolls have spots, and zebras have stripes? The answer's not as straightforward as you think

image.altText: Four people stand in a row. The first one has a yellow shirt and holds a black and white board, the rest wear Islamic dress

props.synopsis: Kamel El Basha fell in love with acting as a child and his first theatre was a window of his home in Jerusalem where he would perform his own plays for the neighbourhood kids.

title.children: As an Arab actor worrying is part of my life': House of Gods' Kamel El Basha on the power of art

image.altText: A close-up picture of a man handing over a set of house keys to a woman.

props.synopsis: It might make sense financially, but there are potential emotional pitfalls in accepting support from family to get into the property market.

title.children: The hidden costs of borrowing from the 'Bank of Mum and Dad'

image.altText: Grandmothers spread flowers at a wedding.

props.synopsis: When Michaela Treloar was planning her wedding, she had no inkling that her big day would turn her and her groom's grandmothers into an online sensation.

title.children: Nonnas go viral as 'flower girls' in South Australian wedding

image.altText: Bad Ancestors

props.synopsis: Whether you like your comedy dark, quirky or just laugh-out-loud funny, this year's entrants in Fresh Blood are putting their short films on the line for your judgement. Cast your critical eye over a selection of the best entries.

title.children: Morbid, offbeat or deadpan: There's something for everyone in these bite-sized comedy gems

image.altText: A calculator on a table with an electricity bill, phone, and pens

props.synopsis: With electricity bills still high, we've compiled a list of the energy-draining appliances that may be spiking your power bill and how to cut costs.

title.children: The power-hungry appliances costing you in your home, and what you can do to save money on your next bill

image.altText: Creative composite with a forest background and the images of five young people cut out in front of it.

props.synopsis: Every project starts with an idea and the drive to make a change. But how do you even start? Five young people give advice on how to get started and how to turn an idea into reality.

title.children: Want to make a change in your community? Here's how to go about it, according to five regional change makers

image.altText: Max Verstappen, in his racing suit, lifts a gold trophy over his head in celebration.

props.synopsis: After producing one of the most dominant seasons in history in 2023, Max Verstappen claims a commanding win and issues a warning shot to those hoping to close the gap with Red Bull.

title.children: World champion Verstappen produces emphatic win to start new F1 season

image.altText: A young woman wearing togs sits on a log on a beach

props.synopsis: As hospitalisations from stingray encounters rise, a young woman recalls a solo snorkelling trip on north Queensland's idyllic Magnetic Island, where she had a marine encounter she will never forget.

title.children: Drew's encounter with a stingray while snorkelling was 'excruciating'. Here's what to do if you get barbed

image.altText: A mural depicting cattle dog and a Guinness World Records sign and title across the top reading, Bluey oldest dog in the world.

props.synopsis: Guinness World Records has stripped Portuguese dog Bobi's title of oldest dog in the world, and reinstated Victorian cattle dog Bluey to the top spot.

title.children: Australia's Bluey reclaims oldest dog record after Guinness World Records reviews Portuguese dog's credentials

image.altText: An elderly woman with medium-length grey hair sitting in front of a black piano.

props.synopsis: For more than seven decades, pianist Mary Sutcliffe regularly played at milestone events in her small country town, but demand has fallen off a cliff in recent years, with the cost of living crisis a major factor.

title.children: Mary's music used to be the soundtrack of her town's weddings and funerals but now she's rarely asked to play at them

image.altText: A medium photo of an injured man with a large bandage on his chest being treated by a woman in a crowded hospital.

props.synopsis: A doctor in Gaza says gunfire caused more than 80 per cent of the wounds seen at his hospital.

title.children: Survivors of Gaza aid chaos say Israeli forces shot at them, as Israel denies striking the convoy

image.altText: Several medicine packs stacked on top of one another

props.synopsis: The drug Ryeqo is approved by the TGA to treat endometriosis. Here's what we know about what it does and how much it costs.

title.children: TGA approves new drug for endometriosis treatment, a first in 13 years

image.altText: A crowd of people standing with flags.

props.synopsis: Labor's Julian Hill warns Cambodia's rulers not to intimidate its critics in Australia, while protesters from several South-East Asian communities are demanding the Albanese government take a stronger stance on human rights abuses during the ASEAN-Australia summit in Melbourne next week.

title.children: Federal MP warns Cambodia's rulers not to intimidate critics ahead of ASEAN-Australia summit

image.altText: A stack of disposable coffee cups.

props.synopsis: The state's environment minister says more than 150 million coffee cups will be saved from landfill each year.

title.children: Western Australia becomes first state to ban non-compostable takeaway coffee cups

image.altText: Hannah Green tees off during third round of LPGA Tour's Women's World Championship.

props.synopsis: Australian Hannah Green is in second place, two shots behind Japanese leader Ayaka Furue, after the third round of the LPGA Tour's Women's World Championship.

title.children: Aussie Green in the mix at LPGA Tour's Women's World Championship

image.altText: Carla snorkel

props.synopsis: A Victorian couple thought never "in a million years" would they again see their mobile phone lost overboard on a Valentine's Day getaway to the Great Barrier Reef.

title.children: Carla found a phone on the ocean floor while scuba diving. When she turned it on, a message appeared

image.altText: man in a wheelchair in front of cattle

props.synopsis: Kangaroo Island farmer Steven Childs, who has quadriplegia, is a tough businessman who likes to take risks. In his latest project, the entrepreneur is spending millions to turn his bushfire-ravaged pine forest into productive farm land.

title.children: Farmer takes on ambitious bushfire-recovery project after life-changing accident

image.altText: A zoomed in photo of a semi-trailer truck and a rescue worker on a line dangling over the side of a large bridge.

props.synopsis: Rescuers are praised as "serious heroes" after saving a driver left high above a river following a three-vehicle crash in the US.

title.children: Video captures truck driver's lucky escape, rescued as their vehicle dangles off a bridge

image.altText: An elderly woman in large, dark framed glasses and a man in a suit

props.synopsis: The designer and textile expert known for her eccentric style is being remembered as a fashion icon.

title.children: Fashion celebrity Iris Apfel has died aged 102
